intro: Pterotheca nemausensis var. glaucescens, commonly known as the glaucous pterotheca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves covered in a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss in arid conditions. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in dense heads, typical of the daisy family. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to full sun exposure.
